author: Stephan Kahl
description: German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil defended the governing coalition’s economic policies and pledged to push ahead with additional reforms by the end of the year to help spur growth.
title: German Finance Chief Pledges Reforms to Reverse Economic Slump

author: Vincent Lee
description: North Korea accused South Korea of a “dangerous provocation” during a recent incident at the border of the two countries, adding to tensions as Pyongyang chafes at the annual joint US-South Korean military drills that are underway.
title: North Korea Says South Korea Fired Warning Shots at Its Soldiers

author: Saleha Mohsin, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: Today on the Big Take: What the Federal Reserve’s Jay Powell said about the possibility of a rate cut in September.
title: Powell Takes the Stage in a Unique Moment for the Federal Reserve

author: Misha Savic, Jasmina Kuzmanovic
description: Lawmakers in the Serb-run half of Bosnia-Herzegovina voted to hold a referendum in defiance of central authorities who recently ordered the Bosnian Serb leader out of office amid growing ethnic tensions in the Balkan nation.
title: Bosnia’s Serbs Set Vote That Risks Plunging Country Into Chaos

author: Patricia Laya
description: President Nicolás Maduro is calling on Venezuelans to enlist in national militias ahead of the potential arrival of US warships in the Caribbean.
title: Maduro Rallies Venezuela Militias Before US Warships Arrival

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump is nominating White House aide Sergio Gor as ambassador to India, elevating the campaign fundraiser and Republican operative to a top diplomatic post at a time when tensions between the two countries are running high.
title: Trump Nominates Personnel Aide Sergio Gor as Ambassador to India

author: Nick Wadhams
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth removed the head of the Defense Intelligence Agency, letting go an Air Force lieutenant general who oversaw an early finding that suggested US strikes on Iran’s nuclear program weren’t as successful as the White House claimed.
title: Hegseth Removes Official Whose Agency Challenged Iran Strike Assessment

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump has called on Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook to resign amid a claim by a top administration official that she may have engaged in so-called mortgage occupancy fraud by falsely labeling a secondary home as her primary residence to get better loan terms. Cook hasn’t been charged with any crimes, but the allegation put a spotlight on what experts say is a relatively common type of financial misconduct.
title: What Is the Mortgage Fraud Lisa Cook Is Accused Of?

author: Jonnelle Marte, Maria Eloisa Capurro
description: At a divided Federal Reserve, policymakers pushing for lower interest rates look close to getting their way after Chair Jerome Powell on Friday opened the door to a cut in September.
title: Powell’s Jackson Hole Signal on Rates Is Good for Just One Cut

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said the US is conducting a “major Tariff Investigation  on Furniture coming into the United States,” setting the stage for industry-specific levies.
title: Trump Announces Furniture Imports Probe, Setting Up Tariffs

author: Enda Curran
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior US economy reporter Enda Curran looks at Fed Chair Powell’s address and the White House reaction. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Powell’s Signal on Possible Rate Cut Not Enough for Trump

author: Manuela Tobias
description: Reeling from a week of political, economic and financial setbacks in Argentina, President Javier Milei now faces a fresh corruption scandal linked to a top government official.
title: Milei Adds a Corruption Scandal to His Mounting List of Woes

author: Chris Strohm
description: The Justice Department released redacted transcripts of Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche’s interview with Jeffrey Epstein’s former associate Ghislaine Maxwell saying she never saw President Donald Trump “in any inappropriate setting.”
title: Ghislaine Maxwell Says She Never Saw Trump ‘in Any Inappropriate Setting’

author: Ben Bartenstein, Eric Martin
description: The Trump administration is withholding approval for several Western oil majors seeking to operate in Venezuela, ramping up pressure on Nicolás Maduro’s government even as Chevron Corp. is allowed to work there, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Withholds Venezuelan Oil Approval for Non-US Majors

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: Dutch Foreign Minister Caspar Veldkamp resigned Friday after fellow cabinet members declined to support further sanctions against Israel.
title: Dutch Foreign Minister Quits as Israel Sanctions Split Cabinet

author: Oscar Medina
description: Miguel Uribe Londoño, father of assassinated Senator Miguel Uribe, will step into Colombia’s 2026 presidential race as a pre-candidate for the opposition Democratic Center party.
title: Slain Colombian Senator Uribe’s Father to Run for Presidency

author: Mishal Husain, K Oanh Ha, Yang Yang
description: Bloomberg's Mishal Husain and Weijian Shan discuss his incredible journey from a life of hard labor in the Gobi Desert to becoming one of Hong Kong's top investors.
title: Weijian Shan on Hong Kong's Future, the U.S.-China Trade War, and his Time in the Gobi Desert

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump again threatened Russia with “massive sanctions” over the war in Ukraine unless an agreement can be reached in about two weeks, swerving back to a tougher stance after an inconclusive meeting with President Vladimir Putin.
title: Trump Again Threatens Russian Sanctions If Ukraine Conflict Doesn’t End

author: Daniel Carvalho, Martha Viotti Beck
description: The once-united clan is creaking under the pressure, leaving the coalition of center-right parties in their orbit in disarray
title: Bolsonaro’s Family Dynasty Creaks Under Pressure of Brazil Coup Trial

author: Myles Miller, Miranda Davis, Georgia Hall
description: President Donald Trump said Friday he’s preparing to expand federal deployments of the National Guard beyond Washington, DC, with Chicago and New York among the cities under review.
title: Trump Eyes Expanding National Guard Deployments to NYC, Chicago

author: Janet Lorin
description: Cornell University signaled more job cuts are coming as it seeks to rethink its finances amid a range of pressures including the Trump administration’s attack on research funding at US colleges.
title: Cornell Warns ‘Urgent Action’ Needed as Trump Cuts Hit Finances

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump announced that Washington’s John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts will host the draw for the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
title: Trump Announces Kennedy Center to Host 2026 World Cup Draw

author: Maxwell Adler
description: The California High-Speed Rail Authority expects to begin passenger service on the Central Valley segment of its long-delayed San Francisco-to-Los Angeles line by 2032, at least a year earlier than a previous Inspector General report estimated, according to a new agency review.
title: LA, SF Hubs Crucial to California High-Speed Rail, Agency Says

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Security in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo is deteriorating amid numerous conflicts, including clashes between Rwanda-backed M23 rebels and Congo’s army, United Nations and UN Security Council members warned Friday.
title: Congo-Rwanda Peace Threated as Fighting Persists, UNSC Warns

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile right-wing presidential candidate Jose Antonio Kast pledged to scrap a capital gains tax on some stock sales and spur investment to propel economic growth, according to the front-runner’s government plan.
title: Chile Presidential Candidate Kast Pledges Investment Incentives

author: Jessica Nix
description: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists recommended Covid vaccines for pregnant women in its updated immunization schedule issued Friday, signaling another split between practicing doctors and the nation’s top health official.
title: Clashing With RFK Jr., OB-GYNs Back Covid Shots During Pregnancy

author: Vernon Silver
description: Mario Draghi said on Friday the events of 2025 have exposed a harsh truth: The European Union can no longer believe its big economy brings it global power and influence.
title: Former ECB Chief Says ‘Illusion’ of EU as a Global Power Dashed

author: Elizabeth Rembert
description: The Medicaid cuts passed in President Donald Trump’s “Big Beautiful Bill” could push rural hospital systems out of the municipal bond market, according to Columbia Threadneedle Investments.
title: Medicaid Cuts ‘Blow Up’ Financing Options for Rural Hospitals

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Patrick Donahue, Alberto Nardelli
description: The renewed push by US President Donald Trump to negotiate an end to Russia’s war in Ukraine has injected more urgency to the latter’s bid for membership of the European Union.
title: Will Ukraine Join the EU? How Membership Offers a Security Guarantee

author: Liam Knox
description: The Trump administration said Friday that George Mason University in northern Virginia had fallen afoul of federal anti-discrimination law and gave the public institution 10 days to “voluntarily resolve” the issues.
title: US Accuses George Mason University of Violating Civil Rights Law

author: Valentina Fuentes
description: Former Finance Minister Mario Marcel helped reduce the perception of risk in Chile to the lowest level in years, no mean feat in a government that originally intended to overhaul the country’s free-market economy and backed a rewrite of the constitution. His surprise resignation Thursday jolted traders.
title: Surprise Exit of Chilean Finance Minister Who Calmed Markets Jolts Traders

author: Myles Miller
description: The order is a reversal for the Army, which had said on Aug. 14 that weapons would be available but “remain in the armory” and that troops wouldn’t make arrests
title: National Guard Troops in DC Will Carry Weapons, Pentagon Says

author: Weilun Soon, Heesu Lee
description: A deal with the White House to help Trump revive US shipbuilding offers a risky route to expansion for South Korean yards.
title: South Korea’s $150 Billion Bet on Trump’s Shipbuilding Dream

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he would seek $2 billion from Congress for beautifying and fighting crime in Washington, DC, the next step in his effort to exert greater authority over the nation’s capital.
title: Trump to Ask Congress for $2 Billion on DC Beautification, Crime

author: Brian Platt
description: Canada will remove its retaliatory tariffs on a long list of US products that comply with the existing North American trade deal, seeking to lower tensions with the White House.
title: Canada to Drop Many Retaliatory Tariffs in Olive Branch to Trump

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump said he would fire Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors if she does not resign her post over mortgage-fraud accusations from a top ally.
title: Trump Says He’ll Fire Fed’s Cook If She Doesn’t Resign

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Deputy Treasury Secretary Michael Faulkender is stepping down from his post, after having played what Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said was a “critical role” at the department.
title: Treasury’s Faulkender Stepping Down as Bessent Lauds His Service

author: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his country’s negotiations with the US have yet to yield an agreement with Russia on potential peace talks.
title: Zelenskiy Says Only Trump Can Stop Putin as Talks Unclear

author: Myles Miller
description: FBI agents carried out a search of former National Security Advisor John Bolton’s home over an investigation regarding classified documents, a person familiar with the matter said on Friday.
title: FBI Searches Home of Trump Critic Bolton Over Documents Probe

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan’s President Lai Ching-te said military spending is expected to reach 5% of GDP by 2030, underscoring his government’s commitment to self-defense to protect the island from China.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Says Defense Spending to Reach 5% of GDP by 2030

author: Eko Listiyorini, Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia’s state agriculture firm Agrinas Pangan Nusantara (Persero) is proposing to turn idle land owned by the army into modern farms at a cost of 870 billion rupiah ($53 million) in a bid to jumpstart the national food estate program.
title: Indonesia Eyes Building $53 Million Modern Farm on Army Land

author: Fred Ojambo
description: Uganda plans to build a new city in an area near Kampala that’s adjacent to a square mile it has offered to R&B singer Akon for development as it seeks to reduce congestion in the capital.
title: Uganda Mulls New City to Decongest Capital as Akon Offer Holds

author: Christine Burke, Zainab Fattah, Abeer Abu Omar
description: Saudi Arabia and the Olympic Council of Asia have begun approaching other countries to potentially take over the 2029 Asian Winter Games as the ski resort designated to host the tournament in the Middle Eastern nation grapples with construction challenges.
title: Saudi Arabia, Olympic Council Weigh Moving Asian Winter Games

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung will press Donald Trump to reopen the stalled dialogue with North Korea when he holds his first summit with the US president next week, his top aide said.
title: South Korea’s Lee to Urge US-North Korea Talks at Trump Summit

author: Anusha Attygalle, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: Sri Lankan police arrested former President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday on allegations he misused government funds while head of state in 2023, AFP reported citing an unidentified police official.
title: Sri Lanka Ex-President Arrested on Alleged Fund Misuse, AFP Says

author: Jarrell Dillard, Chris Cioffi
description: The dozen US states that implemented a refundable child tax credit program in the wake of the pandemic held down child poverty rates relative to states that didn’t act, according to an analysis by Columbia University’s Center on Poverty and Social Policy.
title: State Child Tax Credits Held Down Kids Poverty Rates, Study Shows

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The US leader has moved closer to Vladimir Putin’s position than to that of his European allies following the Alaska summit.
title: Trump’s Tilt Toward Putin Leaves Europe Adrift

author: John Bowker, Alisa Odenheimer
description: A United Nations-backed body declared a famine in Gaza for the first time since the Israel-Hamas war broke out almost two years ago, a finding likely to intensify international calls for a ceasefire and accelerated delivery of aid.
title: UN-Backed Body Declares Famine in Gaza as Ceasefire Calls Grow

author: Chandra Asmara, Norman Harsono
description: Indonesian Deputy Manpower Minister Immanuel Ebenezer has been named a suspect in an extortion case, the first sitting member of President Prabowo Subianto’s cabinet to be involved in an anti-corruption investigation.
title: Prabowo’s Deputy Minister Named Suspect in Indonesia Graft Case

author: Anthony Capaccio, Julie Johnsson
description: Months after Pakistan used a Chinese-made ultra-long-range missile to shoot down Indian fighters, US Air Force and Navy funding requests show they may soon get their own advanced weapon after eight years of development: the Lockheed Martin Corp. AIM-260.
title: Air Force, Navy Seek $1 Billion To Buy Secret Lockheed Missile

author: Constantine Courcoulas, Jorgelina Do Rosario
description: More than a decade after the sovereign debt crisis, Greece is once again at loggerheads with investors. This time the dispute is around a buy back rather than an inability to pay.
title: Greece Faces Investor Fight Over Buyback of Debt Crisis Warrants

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan aims to build a win-win relationship with Africa, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said, underscoring the importance of ties with the resource-rich continent as economic security and geopolitical risks continue to heighten.
title: As US Relations With Africa Sour, Japan Pledges Closer Ties

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Australia and the Philippines plan to enhance their defense cooperation as the Southeast Asian nation boosts ties with allies amid continuing tensions with Beijing in the South China Sea.
title: Australia, Philippines Plan to Enhance Defense Cooperation

author: Lucille Liu, Colum Murphy
description: China used an event marking the final stretch before its biggest diplomatic event of the year to accuse the US of “threatening world peace,” in a thinly veiled critique of the rival superpower just before it hosts a key gathering of global leaders.
title: China Makes Veiled Jab at US Before Hosting Modi, Putin, Erdogan

author: Firat Kozok, Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey sees the potential for faster trade between China and Europe through a South Caucasus corridor set to open as a result of this month’s US-brokered peace deal between Armenia and Azerbaijan — if Washington doesn’t limit its use.
title: Trump Route in Caucasus Can Boost Trade From China If US Allows

author: Antony Sguazzin, Loni Prinsloo, Mathabiso Ralengau
description: One company has a military drone factory and the government has started an investigation.
title: Russia’s Push to Recruit South African Women Triggers Probe

author: Sing Yee Ong, Debby Wu
description: Nuclear power is an “excellent option” for Taiwan, as demand from energy-intensive artificial intelligence is set to skyrocket in the tech manufacturing hub, according to Nvidia Corp.
title: Nvidia Urges Taiwan to Embrace Nuclear Power Ahead of Referendum

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Sakura Murakami
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung is set to embark on his first overseas trip focusing on bilateral diplomacy this weekend starting with a rare Japan visit that will likely set the stage for his first meeting with President Donald Trump in the US days later.
title: South Korean Leader’s Japan Visit to Set Stage for Trump Summit

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Finance Ministry plans to set the provisional rate for interest payments on government bonds at 2.6% for the next fiscal year, the highest level in 17 years, according to a local media report.
title: Japan to Set FY26 Provisional Rate at 17-Year High, Yomiuri Says

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration will not seek equity stakes in chipmakers like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and Micron Technology Inc. that are boosting their US investments, as talks continue on taking a stake in Intel Corp., a US official said.
title: Trump Won’t Seek Equity From Chipmakers With US Investment Plans

author: Colum Murphy
description: A Chinese official expressed solidarity with India against US tariffs on Indian exports, the latest sign of warming ties between the two Asian rivals.
title: China ‘Firmly Stands’ With India on Trump Tariffs, Envoy Says

author: Andy Lin (News), Rajesh Kumar Singh, Shruti Srivastava
description: To seize its opportunity to become a global force in solar power, nation must address tariff tensions and fix a supply chain still hugely reliant on Beijing.
title: US and China Are Thwarting India’s Shot at $7 Trillion Solar Prize
